main event: A bright, white light larger than a star was observed in Forsyth, Montana in February 1961.
interesting points: The object was first observed at an elevation of 20Â° above the horizon,It disappeared down to the horizon after about 30 minutes of observation,The object changed color from bright white to red as it moved farther away,The sighting lasted approximately 30 minutes,The observer reported excellent weather conditions with clear visibility.
witness description: Lt.Capt Miller, Capt. Cooper, and Lieut. Neel
